other_tests.findings: Located in the region of the descending colon, there is extensive fat stranding and fluid seen surrounding a focal segment of colon with associated wall edema and diverticula noted compatible with a focal segment of colitis. No discrete abnormal fluid collections concerning for abscess formation. The lung bases are clear without consolidations, pleural effusions, or pulmonary nodules. The liver, gallbladder, spleen, both adrenal glands, both kidneys, and other than a subcentimeter too small to characterize hypodense lesion within the interpolar region on the right, are unremarkable. There is no intra-abdominal free air. There is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy. There is a small amount of pelvic free fluid noted.
